info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 28 at 3:06AM PDT until March 29 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * CHANGES...Stronger winds anticipated along the US-395 corridor. Slight decrease in high end of snowfall range. * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 3 feet along the Sierra crest with 1 to 2 feet in Mammoth Lakes, June Lakes and across higher passes of Highway 395. Elsewhere, total accumulations of 3 to 8 inches are likely. Winds could gust as high as 65 mph in wind prone locations along Highway 395 and above 100 mph along Sierra ridges. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From 8 AM this morning to 5 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Gusty winds will likely create whiteout conditions and considerable drifting of snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There will be a brief break in the snowfall Wednesday morning. However, snow showers are expected to redevelop Wednesday afternoon and evening with additional accumulations and continued travel impacts expected. Winds will be much lighter Wednesday.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
